data.text: @razibkhan Also, they do testing sampling nationwide, unlike almost anywhere else, and capture those positives who would not be tested elsewhere.
@razibkhan @Katie_Roof They removed all restrictions, including mask wearing. Uptick in cases was always expected.

@razibkhan Elsewhere in that thread a good explanation why it isn't vaccine waning (the boosters were staggered and now all age groups rising in uniform). Probably not BA.2 either, or not entirely (the timing is off).

@razibkhan Boris is toast politically and depends on an extreme faction (the ERG) for survival, so to curry favour he's pushing the msg that it's all over, and ofc people sick of restrictions more than happy to oblige. Cue a massive behavioural change.

https://t.co/I0K4ySNd3O
@razibkhan Ignoring the comparison stuff yields this (the big early Feb case/death spike was likely bogus): https://t.co/m9qYYdgxqj
@razibkhan They are super vaccinated, and many already had it. So another bout is not creating anything like a crisis, and circular cause-effect, they opened up, so more covid circulation.
@razibkhan Perhaps boosters are fading for those who received their third shot around the holidays? Perhaps BA.2 is getting the few remaining covid naive holdouts?
@razibkhan It's hitting a lot of people who escaped it previously.
